name: V-024: Hiab Lorry Mounted Crane Operations

competencies.name: Driver conducts daily checks listed in Defect Book in a well-lit area away from main traffic routes
Driver checks First Aid box including eye wash to ensure it is complete
Driver checks the external cleanliness of the vehicle including lights, number plates , indicators and windows
Driver checks that the cab is clean and free from unauthorised items
Any defects identified and reported to appropriate personnel
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the procedure for reporting defects to appropriate personnel?

competencies.name: Driver wears high-visibility clothing provided by the company together with any other relevant personal protective equipment
Driver has required documentation for their load
Driver ensures that only authorised passengers ride in the vehicle and that seat belts are worn at required times
competencies.supportingText: 1. Why are unauthorised passengers not allowed to ride in the vehicle?

competencies.name: Driver ensures that employees do not ride on the back or any other part of the vehicle
competencies.supportingText: 1. Why is it important that employees do not ride on the back or any other part of the vehicle?

competencies.name: Driver ensures the safety self, the public and other road users when stopping, starting and positioning the vehicle
Driver operates vehicle safely: •following public highway traffic convention•with due consideration to others
Driver ensures that no loading takes place while the vehicle is in motion
Driver check that the vehicle is loaded safely with no over-loading or overhanging items
competencies.supportingText:
1. Why is it necessary to remove over-hanging items?
  2. Why is it necessary to check the vehicle is not over-loaded?

competencies.name: Reversing operations are conducted safely following company procedure (or as detailed in WAP9)
Driver ensures there are no overhead electric cables
Driver ensures that there are no unauthorised persons in the working area
Driver ensures that slings and lifting chains are suitable, firm and will accept the load
Driver checks that slings and lifting chains are in good condition
Driver checks that any slings or chains used are rated higher than the load to be lifted
Driver checks that all slings and chains are labelled and have a current LOLER (Lifting Operations and Lifting Equipment Regulations) test certificate
Driver follows company procedure if chains are not correctly labelled or do not have a current LOLER certificate
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for informing your supervisor if chains are not correctly labelled or do not have a current LOLER certificate?

competencies.name: Driver checks that the safe load indicator is working correctly
Driver maintains three points of contact with the vehicle if climbing onto the crane’s operating seat
Driver deploys the stabiliser legs and ensures the vehicle is level before commencing any crane operation
Driver carries out a test lift if unsure about the weight of the load to be lifted
Driver does not operate the crane over the cab of the vehicle

sections.name: C - Crane Operation – Lift and Post-lift

competencies.name: Driver ensures that the load is correctly secured on the vehicle
Driver ensures that people are kept away from the area where the load will be deposited
Driver ensures that no one walks under the suspended load
Driver ensures that the vehicle bed is clean after unloading
Driver ensures that all lashings and chocks are stowed correctly
Driver stows stabiliser legs
Driver returns the crane to the correct position
Driver follows company procedure if the crane or stabiliser legs will not go into the travel position and does not attempt to move the vehicle
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for informing your supervisor if the crane or stabiliser legs will not go into the travel position?

competencies.name: Driver checks for overhead electrical cables
Driver ensures that a delivered container and the type of vehicle servicing the container will not get entangled with overhead cables
Driver operates within the agreed clearances for live electrical cables depending on voltage
competencies.supportingText: 1. How do you establish the safe clearance height for electrical cable?

competencies.name: Driver remains in cab if vehicle is touching live cables or cable is arcing to vehicle
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure if vehicle is touching live cables or cable is arcing to vehicle?

competencies.name: Driver follows company procedure to notify regional electricity provider or customer where applicable
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for notifying the regional electricity provider and customer?

competencies.name: Driver discourages people from approaching the vehicle
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for discouraging people from approaching the vehicle?

competencies.name: Driver leaves the cab only when the cables have been isolated
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for leaving the cab?

competencies.name: Driver jumps as far from the cab as possible in an emergency when overhead cables are still live
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for jumping clear of the cab when overhead cables are still live?

competencies.name: Driver does not approach the vehicle until the electricity provider has confirmed that the cable is isolated
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for confirming that the electricity provider has isolated the cable?

competencies.name: The driver is the only person to operate the crane
Driver ensures that the vehicle is unloaded safely
Driver is aware of and complies with all site safety rules when on customer’s premises or tipping sites
competencies.supportingText:
1. What are the major safety rules that must be complied with on customer’s premises?
  2. What are the major safety rules that must be complied with on tipping sites?

competencies.name: Driver does not stand, or allow others to stand, or work under unpropped bodies or suspended loads
Driver ensures that the site is closed or the area cordoned off and all persons clear of the area before loading or unloading
Driver identifies when a load has become unstable or dangerous or where unforeseen spillages occur and stops activity
Driver assesses and takes safe action to readjust the load
Driver follows company procedure when load cannot be made safe and calls for assistance
